main event: On February 22, 1956, multiple residents of Hampton-Sydney College observed two unidentified flying objects over the college campus.
interesting points: The first object was described as a round, silvery dollar-sized object glowing in different colors, including red, green, blue, and brilliant white., The sighting lasted approximately 45 minutes, with the first object fading as the second one appeared., One observer who studied astronomy confirmed it was not a shooting star., The objects were tracked moving in a southwestern direction., Investigations could not confirm the existence of any weather balloons launched in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: two round, glowing objects in the sky
witness description: students and residents of Hampton-Sydney College, including individuals with good vision and some with knowledge of astronomy.
